greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n > 1 as a power of a product n = (x_1*..*x_k)^y, where y >= 1, x_i > 1, and x_i <= x_j for i < j.
comment: a(1)=infinity is not an integer so is necessarily omitted from the data.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
example: The a(64)=17 ways to write 64 as a power of a product:
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 30 2017
